title: The Decaf Deception
setting: Apex Digital Agency, kitchen area, Monday 10 AM
premise: Someone replaced the regular coffee beans in the office grinder with decaf. The switch happened between 8 AM and 9:30 AM Monday. The decaf bag was found stuffed behind the microwave.

suspects.name: Pete Callahan
suspects.motive: His doctor told him the whole team drinks too much caffeine
suspects.alibi: I arrived at 8:15 and went straight to my corner office on the east side. I was on back-to-back video calls from 8:30 to 10:00. My calendar confirms it.

suspects.name: Aisha Mbeki
suspects.motive: Lost a bet with a friend that she could get the office off caffeine for one day
suspects.alibi: I got in at 8:45 and made myself tea in the kitchen. Then I went to my desk and was on the phone with a client from 9:00 to 9:45. The client can confirm.

suspects.name: Rick Donovan
suspects.motive: Thinks decaf tastes better and has been lobbying for the switch
suspects.alibi: I arrived at exactly 9:00 AM. I walked past the kitchen but didn't stop because I was running late for the 9:00 Monday standup in the west wing meeting room.

suspects.name: Tammy Nguyen
suspects.motive: Caffeine gives her migraines and she's tired of smelling it
suspects.alibi: I was the first one in at 7:50 AM. I grabbed coffee from the kitchen and took it to my desk. I didn't go back to the kitchen until 10 when I noticed it tasted weird.

clues.title: Kitchen Traffic
clues.content: The intern says the kitchen was empty when she grabbed water at 8:40 AM, but she noticed someone had left a grocery bag on the counter that wasn't there at 8:00 AM.

clues.title: Receipt Found
clues.content: A receipt from the Corner Grocery (across the street) for decaf beans was found in the recycling bin. It was timestamped 8:22 AM Monday morning.

clues.title: Video Call Check
clues.content: IT pulled Pete's meeting records. His first video call Monday actually started at 9:15 AM, not 8:30 AM. There is a forty-five minute gap in his morning schedule.
